page.title: 01 "INTRODUCTION"
page.content: The area of 12 sq.kilometres (2965 acres) is some 5 miles North West of Derby. It is gently undulating open country lying generally between the 100m and 125m contours with the highest point 154m,the lowest 84m. Rainfall averages about 28 inches and the area is drained by many small brooks, flowing South Eastwards to the River Derwent. The soils are generally fertile and provide for medium sized family dairy farms and larger arable farms. Dairying is based on cultivated grass for grazing, silage and some hay. Both the farming systems are highly mechanised. The cows are predominatly Friesians'. Small numbers of sheep are kept on both types of farm.There are a few ley cattle. There are no large intesive pig or poultry units. The area is well wooded with many
